filteredArticles.headline: Meet the candidates, including a Penn grad, for West Philadelphia seat in Pa. legislature

filteredArticles.headline: The Pa. mail-in ballot application deadline is May 26. Here’s what you need to know.
filteredArticles.abstract: Voters with Pennsylvania identification can apply for a mail-in or absentee ballot online, while non-identification holding voters must email, call, or mail in a request to receive a ballot.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn for Bernie becomes Penn Justice Democrats, a leftist group for progressive activism
filteredArticles.abstract: The group hopes to diversify what it feels is a dominant pre-professional atmosphere on campus by fostering electoral engagement and progressive activism.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Sanders wants Biden in the White House. Penn for Bernie does not.

dominantMedia.content: Most of the Penn for Bernie board leadership is expected to carry over to Penn Justice Democrats.

filteredArticles.headline: CAFSA cuts ties with Penn Dems after it endorsed Biden, who faces sexual assault allegation
filteredArticles.abstract: CAFSA, an on-campus organization officially founded in September 2019 to combat rape culture and support historically underrepresented identities, removed Penn Dems from their coalition after they endorsed presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

filteredArticles.headline: Online 2020 Census format allows Penn students to be counted in Phila. from quarantine
filteredArticles.abstract: Even though most students have now left Penn's campus, students should still be counted as living in Philadelphia, or where they would have been living on April 1 had the coronavirus not displaced them.

filteredArticles.headline: Biden's claim of being a 'teacher' at Penn drew scrutiny. Here's what his role really was.
filteredArticles.abstract: Though Biden does not share the alumni status of 1968 Wharton graduate Donald Trump, several members of the Biden family have graduated from Penn’s various schools, and the former vice president served as a Penn presidential professor of practice.

filteredArticles.headline: Elizabeth Warren endorses fellow former Penn prof. Joe Biden for president
filteredArticles.abstract: Warren taught at Penn Law in the 1980s and 1990s, and Biden served as a Benjamin Franklin Presidential Professor of Practice from 2017 until he launched his campaign in 2019.

filteredArticles.headline: Sanders wants Biden in the White House. Penn for Bernie does not.
filteredArticles.abstract: Penn for Bernie's board members wrote in an emailed statement to The Daily Pennsylvanian that although they "revere" Sanders, they do not agree with his decision and "are not a cult who will follow him in each and every direction."
